message: Personally, I love about half of it, and am very "meh" on the other half.
Now that we've had a few days to listen to it, what are thoughts on it?
http://mobile.twitter.com/drunkhulk/status/39398657803558912
i don't like it a lot, too experimental and too "soft" for me, but maybe after more listening it i will ike it more
I loves it tho
I like it, no hits but very enjoyable listen
It's not harder than some old Can albums or the weirder Frank Zappa
it's not pop also, but who expected a pop record?
It's a really hard album to nail down
It's music for current generation.
A bit of experimental stuff and short enough
feels like everyone's still digesting it
It´s a grower, right now I'm listening to in Rainbows, and then TKL, maybe I'll get it better
i had to listen to it LOUD a few times to see all the really dope stuff going on in the background, but 'seperator' right now is the best so far
this is the fastest i've liked a radiohead album except for OKC
which is odd considering the verdict i've heard from other people
@pimeys Can ++
TIL Thom Yorke hates bees 24.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_lh5637fCg51qzcik8o1_500.gif

It took me quite a few listens, but after listening to it on a really good stereo there's a whole lot of great stuff going on. Now I can't stop listening to it. It's been on repeat nearly all week. If you listen to Miles Davis (Kind of Blue and later) and John Coltrane, throw in some Sun Ra this album is a natural progression.
Overall, not my favorite Radiohead but another great album from another great band.
-another
I'm a few listens in, and so far I think it's really great
I really love what they've done with the rhythms on this; I feel like it builds on the success of In Rainbows in all the right places
i think it's a question of time, now i like it, really nice to listen it before sleeping, or while skiing.
To my mind it's just more thomeyorkish than radioheadish, pretty similar to "the eraser" and also "in rainbows". Still pretty good, I like it
